queries: What did Tim Cook say about Apple's supply chain?
Tesla battery technology developments in Q3 2024
Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella compensation details
Goldman Sachs investment in fintech startups
Bank of America credit risk exposure
Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway portfolio changes
Nvidia AI chip sales to data centers
AMD market share in server processors
sample_texts: Apple Inc. (AAPL) reported strong quarterly earnings. CEO Tim Cook discussed supply chain challenges and highlighted 15% revenue growth in the Services segment.
Tesla Inc. (TSLA) announced breakthrough battery technology developments. The company expects 20% cost reduction per kilowatt-hour by Q4 2024.
JPMorgan Chase (JPM) posted Q3 earnings of $4.37 per share, beating analyst expectations. The investment banking division saw 25% year-over-year growth.
Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) expanded Azure cloud services. CEO Satya Nadella emphasized AI integration across all product lines.
Amazon Web Services (AWS) revenue grew 20% year-over-year, reaching $23.1 billion in Q3 2024. Operating margin improved to 30%.
Goldman Sachs (GS) increased investment in fintech startups by $500 million. The firm targets blockchain-based settlement infrastructure.
Meta Platforms Inc. (META) reported declining advertising revenue amid increased competition. CEO Mark Zuckerberg outlined metaverse investment strategy.
Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) Google Cloud achieved $8.4 billion in quarterly revenue. The division approaches profitability with 37% growth rate.
Bank of America Corporation (BAC) disclosed credit risk exposure of $2.1 trillion across commercial and consumer portfolios.
Wells Fargo & Company (WFC) mortgage lending declined 30% year-over-year due to rising interest rates and reduced refinancing activity.
